channel.title: Is RSBot safe?
channel.description: So I heard a couple months back that it was infected, and I want to make money and I have an acc with 92 wc or w/e it has, should I use RSBot or is it still infected? Don't feel like making this a long topic, so reply yes or no or w/e you want to do, I'm a bit tired.

item.title: Is RSBot safe?
item.dc:creator: @runescape_sucks runescape sucks
item.description:
@runescape_sucks wrote:

Try EpicBot it is best bot i ever used… well its the only. 100% free

Read full topic

item.title: Is RSBot safe?

item.description:
@pk2play wrote:

Probably not there is so much out there already.

Read full topic

item.title: Is RSBot safe?
item.dc:creator: @Fridder Fridder
item.description:
@Fridder wrote:

[quote=“Andrew Ferguson, post:14, topic:400781”][quote author=Fridder link=topic=497837.msg3642676#msg3642676 date=1309128744]
Ok I’m using RSbuddy as everybody suggested.
It’s sexy but not open source. I like to modify the scripts to make them sexy and fix the bugs the dumb developers don’t know how to fix.

[/quote]
Well you have to think, most of people who release scripts get paid for them being on the site (based on the number of users on the script) if they released it open source other would take it and impove it and they would loose the money they were getting for building it in the first place.[/quote]

Can I make money for making a woodcutting script? :o

Read full topic

Well you have to think, most of people who release scripts get paid for them being on the site (based on the number of users on the script) if they released it open source other would take it and impove it and they would loose the money they were getting for building it in the first place.

item.title: Is RSBot safe?
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

[quote=“Mod Whip, post:8, topic:400781”]Is there any proof out there that rsbuddy doesn’t steal accounts? Haven’t found any

Is there any proof that rsbot doesn’t steal accounts? https://github.com/powerbot/RSBot

been using rsbot for over a year now, haven’t gotten hacked at all.[/quote]Being open source doesn’t prevent their scripts from modifying themselves. All it means is that the creator of the site is showing his code. Does it even guarantee the jar he uploads is the same as the source he posts? Nope. Unlike PowerBot, RSBuddy is run by a trusted individuals, that don’t do things like add ‘pay per click’ links to all references, or sell stickies, or modify the host files of their users (illegally), or put 10 banners on every page of the site. They also have a much better script checkout/submission and malicious content systems.

That being said, your account is never 100% safe if you enter your password anywhere.

Read full topic
